messages.message: Hi All - quick thing on split classify I have noticed. When it is used for packets that are long (80+ pages), the system seems to freeze a lot whenever it is trying to split up. Once it is trying to split up and freezes, we have the option to either force quit and wait for the project to timeout, or wait for the system to catch up. For example - I put 1 loan packet in this project (typically id assume clients use more than 1 to test/prompt). I added all the doctypes to the right, then hit classify - after this, the system spent 12ish minutes classifying the single packet. When i tried to exit out and rejoin the project, the operation was still happening and I had to wait for it to lag out. Any ideas on how to reduce the lag on training/interacting with docs post classification step? Every time you need to backout, the doc needs to reclassify

@Andrew Sherrill we’ve been looking into some performance issues around projects with many documents. Is this on prod? There should be some changes that land on prod tonight that will hopefully improve performance, but please follow up afterwards if you’re still seeing this issue later
yeah on prod - will check tonight and let you know tomorrow. Thanks!
To be fair, the actual processing once the app is created is probably okay (3 min is long but way faster here and across 3 packets versus 1)
nice. Within Build I wouldn’t expect the length of time for the classification to get faster but you should expect things to be less laggy/more smooth after the prod push
